definition: fashionable for a while (idiom); all the rage
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit

sentences.english: Remember that number puzzle craze a couple of years back?
sentences.chinese: 還記得風靡一時的數字拼圖遊戲嗎？

sentences.english: These \"upside down\" trees were all the rage last year.
sentences.chinese: 這些是去年風靡一時的“倒立”聖誕樹。

sentences.english: They hope it will be a hit, but will it?
sentences.chinese: 他們希望這間店會風靡一時，但它會嗎？

sentences.english: The vinegar-drinking trend gained momentum in 2004, when black vinegar became all the rage.
sentences.chinese: 2004年黑醋風靡一時之際，飲醋風潮開始盛行。

sentences.english: Black leather trousers seem to be quite the rage these days.
sentences.chinese: 近來黑色皮褲似乎風靡一時。

sentences.english: "covenant-lite" loans, which imposed few restrictions on borrowers, were all the rage.
sentences.chinese: 對借款人幾乎沒有限制的“低門檻”貸款風靡一時。

sentences.english: That pop-song had a great vogue at one time.
sentences.chinese: 那首流行歌曲曾經風靡一時。

sentences.english: Lithographic illustrations of novels was very popular.
sentences.chinese: 石印插圖本小說風靡一時。

definition: to win instant success (idiom)/to become an instant hit
Tale of the White Snake/Madame White Snake
to have a unique style of one's own (idiom)
Heaven Sword and Dragon Saber, wuxia (武俠|武侠[wu3 xia2], martial arts chivalry) novel by Jin Yong 金庸[Jin1 Yong1] and its screen adaptations
